dialogues.text: I really can't buy anything right now,  Seth.  My wife and I are buying a house  this month and we're saving every last  penny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I don't care how much stock you  pick up.  I just want you to test me  out.  Harry, I want you to judge me on  the percentages I show you. Obviously I  show you thirty or forty percent, no  matter how big or small your position  is you're gonna get pretty excited  about my next idea, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you would.  You'd be handing  out my business cards, wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick up one hundred shares.  It's the  absolute firm minimum.  Okay, if I show  you three or four points on the trade  it's not going to make you rich.  On  the same token, if the stock doesn't go  anywhere you're not out in front of  your store with a cup in your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughs) No, that's true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (serious) Look Harry, the truth is I could sell  you a lot more than one hundred shares  and feel completely comfortable about  the trade, but I'm asking you to start  small just to prove what I can do for  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great!  Should I send the confirmation  to your business or your home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well I just have to talk to my wife  first.  Then I'll call you right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to do that, Harry.  And  I going to lunch in five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I have to talk to her first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to ask you something here,  Harry.  You're at work now, aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well what do you do, Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm the purchasing manager for a  gourmet foods company.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does part of your job involve making  decisions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, well when you make one of  these decisions do you call your wife  to ask her what you should do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (a little annoyed) No, of course not.  But that's a little  bit...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Different?  How?  It's your money, you  earned it.  Besides, all you're doing  is investing it.  I'm not selling crack  here, Harry.  I  mean she's only going  to be happy when she sees you've made a  wise investment for the family.  Just  think of the flip side.   When your wife does the shopping does  she call you from Pathmark to ask you  if she can use the coupons for Captain  Crunch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, that's not fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just trying to make a point here,  Harry.  We're not talking about a lot  of money.  Just think what she's going  to say when you bring her back a big  fat check because you had the foresight  to see a good thing coming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long pause) Alright, let's try it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A large van with tinted windows sits in an adjacent lot. cable runs from the rear of the van to a telephone pole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent True sits in the van with headphones on.  The van i completely decked out in surveillance gears.  True looks  slightly amazed.  He slowly pulls the headphones off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This kid is really good.  God, he's  gonna go down hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone in the firm is present tonight.  They all face t front of the room, waiting.  Seth sits next to Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the deal here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael always addresses the firm when  there's a new issue coming out.  It's  always good news.  I heard we might be  taking a trip south after this meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth looks at Chris for further explanation but Michael w up to the front of the room and it quickly quiets down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's everybody doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room erupts into cheers at this simple question.  Som yell out Michael's name.  There is a strong energy in the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good to hear.  First thing, I wanted to  congratulate you all on a huge month.   For any of you not yet convinced, these  were the top dogs for the month: Jim  Young -- $280,000.  Chris Varick -  $205,000.  Greg Feinstein - $190,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The room again breaks into cheers.  Greg and Chris gets p on the shoulder.  Seth looks at Chris in awe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This month is going to be bigger.  It's  actually going to be the biggest month  we've ever had.  We've got a new issue  I want to talk to you about.  It's  called Med Patent.  They've just  designed the world's first retractable  syringe.  This means that doctors and  nurses will never again have to worry  about infection from dirty needles.  This is not going to be an alternative  in the medical world, it's going to be  the standard.  We all know we're here  to make money, but if we can do  something good like this, then all the  better.  So I want you all to go out  and buy yourselves a new car, or a  house.  Whatever you want.  Go into  debt.  You will make a million inside  of six months.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place goes wild.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, onto matters of recreation.  We're  taking a class trip tonight so call the  ladies and tell them not to wait up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone walks out the front doors of JT Marlin to find s luxury buses waiting in the parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fade up on Seth walking down a hall towards the suite.  H passes the half open door and sees a prostitute smoking a cigarette in between "shifts".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Seth, you want some of this?  Just  get in line, bro.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah, that's alright.  I'm gonna go hit  the tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (laughing) Fuckin' fag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's me.  Can't get enough dick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth drives down a rundown street in Red Hook, Brooklyn. gets out of the car by an obviously abandoned building. walks up to a window and wipes off the dust.  It's empty. He turns to leave when he notices a decrepit sign against wall.  He bends down to read the faded name -- MED PATENT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Debbie sit staring at the skyline.  Debbie reall feels for him.  We see that here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sighs) What's wrong?  Everything, it feels  like.  Not you, but everything else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things aren't right at work.  I'm sick  of opening accounts for Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're almost done, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie stares at him deeply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's something else.  It's your  father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...Yeah, actually, it is.  We're  finally getting along.  I mean we're  having lunch next week on his request.   Do you know how happy that shit makes  me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But it's all based on this fucking job.   This very legitimate respectable job.   A job he can tell his friends about  during the Yom Kippur appeal.  And it's  all bullshit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then you'll quit.  You'll tell him what  was happening and he'll respect you for  walking away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do that!  I've invested too  much time and energy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth takes a deep breath here and stares at Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Talk to me, Seth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured out how Michael's making his  money.  I almost wish I hadn't; because  it's all illegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It really is, huh?  Well we knew it was  shady.  So how's he doing it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's called bridge financing.  It's so  simple.  A group of investors make a  loan to a private company.  Let's say  for three million.  After the company  gets taken public they pay back a  million in cash and the other two they  pay back in common stock, but at the  IPO price.  So the investors basically  get two million worth of IPO stock.   Then they can sell it on the open  market at triple what they bought it  for.  Now that's actually all legal as  long as the investors are not tied to  the brokerage house.  But Michael's  friends are the investors on every IPO  we do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why all the names were the same  on the contracts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Then he has us push it all on  the open market.  We're selling  Michael's shares.  That's where the two  dollar rips come in.  He can afford to  pay us that much.  He's still in an  obscene profit margin.  It's to his  advantage to give us those rips.  He  has to motivate us to push these  stocks.  He depends on us to literally  create the market.  It's all artificial  demand.  There's no other firm selling  this shit.  That's why he's always  telling us to go into debt.  He wants  us hungry.  Then as soon as we sell off  Michael's position there's no need to  maintain the inflated price anymore.   We stop pushing it and it crashes.  And  get this.  The last IPO, Med Patent,  it's cardboard.  No research and  development, no employees, not even a  fucking building.  Annual reports are  all bullshit.  Michael manufactures  them.  Med Patent doesn't exist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, Seth.  Now what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now?  I don't know.  Maybe now I go do  it for myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The casino is barely full.  Seth stands there exhausted,  surveying the scene.  Jeff walks over and hands Seth an  envelope.  They exchange hellos but nothing more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth reaches over to the monitor and switches it on.  He  opens the envelope and empties about $5,000 onto the bed. He looks very upset as he counts out the money finally  throwing it on the bed and then YELLING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeff!  Come on up here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see Jeff's head snap up as he stares at Seth through t monitor.  He leaves the table as another dealer replaces

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?  One week I can  understand, but this is approaching  four months, and we're down forty  percent from the last month I was here  full time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck do you want from me?  I'm  not you, Seth.  I'm not going to kill  myself for half the profit.  You get to  come in here and just pick up your  money and it sucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  It's my business.  I created it,  remember?  You used to make ten dollars  an hour.  Now you're pulling in a  thousand a week.  And you're still not  happy?  What the fuck is that?  And you  still haven't answered me as to why  profits are down this much.  What's  going on, Jeff?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing, you can check the tapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?  I didn't say anything.  You  skimming, Jeff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I'm not.  Look, we've been closing  earlier than usual and we've been  opening later.  I can't handle the  twenty-four hour gig anymore, Seth.   This isn't Denny's.  I'm trying to  finish school here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth breathes heavy.  This is his real source of income.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright look, why don't you take on  another partner and split your end  which I'll up to sixty-five percent.   Then you can work at night and go to  school during the day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm already doing that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (surprised) You are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I took Dave on last month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you still can't handle it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth looks off toward the wall and then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is working on dinner.  His two young children, MAX SARA, laugh at their father who makes funny faces at them Harry turns away and then turns back with two stalks of  asparagus coming out of his mouth like tusks.  He mimics walrus for his children who laugh hysterically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!  You look ridiculous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's funny, Dad.  Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max eats some asparagus while still smiling at his Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Dad, my pee smells funny after I  eat this stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, mine too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry's wife, SUSAN, walks in with the mail in her hands. She's 32, both plain and smart looking.  She looks throug the mail while taking her coat off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay guys, let's settle down.  You  really have a knack at stimulating  great conversation with the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it's a talent huh?  I found out  that the new medical program includes  dental.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you serious?  That's great.  You  hear this, kids?  You're going to get  to go to the dentist for free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Both Sara and Max both grimace at the same time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great job, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan sees a piece of mail that catches her eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, who's JT Marlin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah, I forgot to tell you.  I  brought a little bit of stock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did you buy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's this great pharmaceutical  company that's poised for a big jump.   They make this new drug that helps  premature babies survive their initial  three months.  Isn't that great?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much did you buy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing crazy, Susan.  Just a hundred  shares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At with price?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eight dollars.  Take it easy hon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan relaxes somewhat at this answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you even know who to call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well actually, he called me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth Davis.  The broker.  He's a really  great guy.  Family man actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he get your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doesn't that worry you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, not particularly. (abruptly) Hey look, it's okay!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan and the kids all detect this change in tone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (calmly) It's a small investment and I'm just  testing this guy out.  If he doesn't  show us any gains on this trade then I  won't do business with him again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth kneels on the floor rolling dice with some other  brokers.  He turns to see a kid sitting in the waiting ro staring at him just like he did months earlier. Jim walks in and all of the brokers jump to find seats. drops his coat on the desk and starts right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is gonna be a quick one, boys.   You passed your sevens over a month  ago, and yet no one has opened the  necessary forty accounts for their team  leader yet.  Seth is the only one of  you that's even close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth looks at his hands.  Doesn't need to stick it to any

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did it in twenty-six days when I was  a junior broker.  You're not sending  out press packets anymore.  None of  this Debbie the Time Life operator  shit.  It's time to go to work.  Get on  the phones and be aggressive. (uncovering his coffee) I remember this guy once called me to  sell me some stock.  I let him pitch  me.  I got every fucking rebuttal out  of this guy.  Kept him on the phone for  an hour and a half.  Toward the end I  started asking him buying questions.   Like, what's the firm minimum?  That's  a buying question.  I ask a question  like that, he should take me down.   It's not like I asked him what his 800  number was.  That's a fuck off  question.  I was giving him a run but  he blew it.  To a question like, What's  the firm minimum the answer is zero!   You don't like the idea, don't pick up  a single share.  This putz is telling  me... (mocking) ...ummm, a hundred shares?  Wrong  answer!  You have to learn how to  close.  Always be closing!  You have to  push.  Keep asking questions.  Ask  rhetorical ones just to get a yes out  of them.  If you were drowning and I  threw you a life jacket would you grab  it?  Yes?  Good.  Pick up two hundred  shares, I won't let you down.  Ask a  guy if he'll let you down.   Ask a guy if he'll be happy to see  thirty to forty percent return.  What's  he gonna say?  Fuck you, I don't want  to see those returns?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop laughing, it's not funny.  If you  can't close then start thinking about  another career.  I'm serious.  I am  dead serious about that.  Have your  rebuttals ready.  Anybody says call me  tomorrow, that's bullshit!  Anybody  says they got money problems about two  hundred shares is lying.  You know what  I say to that?  Tell me you don't like  my idea, tell me you don't like my  firm, tell me you don't like my fucking  tie, but don't tell me you can't pull  twenty five hundred together.  You hear  me, boys?  There is no such thing as a  "no sale" call.  A sale is made on  every call you make.  You either sell  the client some stock or he sells you a  reason he can't.  Either way it's a  sale.  The question is, who's gonna  close, you or him?  Be relentless!   Alright, I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jim walks out as suddenly as he came in.  Seth ambles out the office.  He has many things on his mind.  He sees Chr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How smooth is that motherfucker?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too smooth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth follows him to the back where he's making a copy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So Chris, I've been reading the  contracts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the IPO's? (laughs) I was just kidding.  No one really  reads them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.  Anyway the company we're  selling now that makes that retractable  syringe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Med Patent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  Well, I was reading their  prospectus and... Well, they don't fill  the minimum requirements to be taken  public.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, you just started here.  You can't  possibly know what the fuck you're  talking about.  You didn't even finish  college.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.  To float a stock , you  need at least two years worth of  audited financial statements.  They  don't have any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Seth.  I thought we already went  through this.  You're a good kid, and I  like you a lot, but this is bullshit.   Michael knows all about this stuff.  We  don't.  He doesn't tell you how to  trade, so don't tell him how to do his  business.  He's the reason we make  bank, and he hasn't steered us wrong,  ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris.  I went to the address listed on  the prospectus. It's an abandoned  building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris grabs Seth and SHOVES him into a corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me, Seth, and listen good.  I  will back you up against Greg or  anybody else that fucks with you.  But  on this I am telling you to shut the  fuck up.  You will not rock this boat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth looks stunned and Chris realizes he may have gone a overboard.  He tries to reel things back in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now how many more accounts do you owe  Greg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you'll be out of Greg's reach in a  couple of days.  Knock them off and  you're on your own.  You're gonna make  a lot of money after that.  A lot of  money, Seth.  Just don't fuck it up now  'cause you're pissed at Greg.  Got it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah Chris.  I got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake and Chris pulls him into a short, masculine hu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a good kid.  Too fucking smart  though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's late afternoon as Seth walks out the front door.  He heads toward the building he saw Michael and the other gu go into.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The building is brand new and he wonders where to begin w a JANITOR rounds the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, how you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm trying to find the space that our  company just rented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the name of the company?  We've  only rented out a couple of offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JT Marlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.  No company by that name.  You  sure you got the right building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Michael Brantley told me to come  by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Michael.  Big guy, maybe thirty years  old?  Sharp dresser?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, that's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Second floor.  Suite 206.  You can go  up and have a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not locked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nah.  Just cheap phones in there,  that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth finds the suite and opens the door.  He stops in  amazement.  It's the identical set up of JT Marlin's floo The desks are all in and there are close to 400 phones in room.  Nothing else.  Suddenly he hears VOICES from aroun the corner of the L-shaped room.  He ducks behind a filin cabinet.  Michael and John Feiner come around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now if the heat does come and we have  to jump, how long will it take to move  the whole firm?  I mean everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under two hours, literally.  They'll be  making calls that afternoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth bounds up the front steps into the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth quietly enters the courtroom.  It's almost full.  Th guard instantly recognizes him and they shake hands. Seth sits down in the back and watches his father sitting on the bench.  Marty does not see him.  Seth looks on in  wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth and Marty are eating pastrami sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you think of the suit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) You're asking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.  You've got good taste in  clothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually I like it a lot.  I noticed it  earlier.  Real departure for you  though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not the usual stodgy old judge garb  huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  You even nailed the tie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles) Even?  Are you going to start investing  my money soon?  I could use a better  return than Fidelity's getting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I'm ready for that.   Too much pressure.  Imagine if I lost  your retirement fund on some small-cap  stock.  God, that would be funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, hysterical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what kind of stocks are you trading  these days?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (answers carefully) Mostly tech and pharmaceuticals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got any tips for me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad.  I didn't know you had it in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?  I never said I didn't like to  make money.  It's the method I've  always been concerned about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty looks at his son, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See Seth, we're having lunch here like  real people.  I told you we could get  to this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (somber) You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie is answering incoming calls.  She answers one call after another until one call makes her FREEZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JT Marlin, how may I direct your call?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'll just talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (extremely nervous) Why are you calling me here?  I told  you I would talk to you as soon as I  knew.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time's running out, Deb.  I need to  know what he's doing.  Serve him up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't done anything wrong.  There'  nothing I can tell you.  Why don't you  go after Feinstein or one of the other  guys?  Seth's a good kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want to nail those other guys.   We're not interested in putting Seth  away.  So if you care about him so much  then you better find something on him.   Your immunity deal won't be on the  table forever.   I'm just thinking about your mother  that's all.  One of us has to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True hangs up.  Debbie's badly shaken.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry sits in the living room looking at the Wall Street  Journal.  He's nervous.  He keeps looking toward the door like an adolescent with a porn magazine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth is on the phone closing his 40th and final account a junior broker.  We are very TIGHT ON Seth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only problem you're going to have  is that I didn't come down there an  twist your arm to buy a thousand  shares.  You simply have no idea what  you've tapped into here today.  That's  right.  My secretary will take all your  information.  I have to hop.  Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth pushes the hold button and we pull out to see that t whole table was listening in.  Chris looks proud.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make it so, Sheryl. (then yelling) Yes!  Finally!  My first whale and my  first account.  My book baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg calls out from the head of the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Seth, hate to bust in on your  little victory speech, but that's your  fortieth account.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  So it's mine.  I'm out of the  junior broker program.  I don't work  for you No Mo'!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well you're out, but that account's  mine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck that.  I keep the fortieth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth looks around to see everyone going back to their sea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this about Debbie?  Are you that  bitter?  I have made you a lot of money  over the last three months, more than  any other trainee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry Seth.  I couldn't do it if I  wanted to.  It's the rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, come on, Greg.  You can bend the  rules.  I gave my guys...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the fuck out of here, Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg gets up and walks toward Seth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yourself these days, man.  Not  yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you, Greg.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg moves very quickly toward Seth who doesn't react qui enough.  Greg SHOVES him hard enough to send him sprawlin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on my team, I'm not on yours.   Try to remember that bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth is waiting near a fountain.  He looks around nervous A black man approaches, pushing a baby carriage. He is  dressed in hip-hop styled clothing.  Seth looks at the ma he passes and then turns to catch a glimpse of the baby. Instead, he sees a huge boom-box in the carriage. Marty emerges behind him.  He looks irate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (icy, controlled) I spoke to Howard Goldberg over at  Prudential.  You lied again you  unbelievable piece... You lied to all  of us.  He told me all about JT Marlin.   A chop shop.  You've been selling their  shit all this time.  How many people  have you fucked over so far, Seth?   Huh?  How many?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth does not answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All that bullshit about them wanting to  know you how the business works.  The  great training program.  Profits you've  heard for your customers!  Did you make  them anything?  Just tell me, did you  make them any money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Not a penny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm done with you, Seth.  This is it.   You're out of our lives.  I don't want  to see you again.  Don't come by the  house, don't call.  This is worse than  the casino.  You've been stealing here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was gonna tell you, Dad.  I was just  waiting for the right time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty turns and walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're fighting.  Max and Sara are sitting on the floor the hallway outside their bedroom.  They're scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think I want to live in this  apartment the rest of my life?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes I wonder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh please!  I'm the one who got the  raise, Susan, try and remember that.   I'm the one that goes out every day and  supports this family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't keep using that shit, Harry.   I've told you a million times I have no  problem going out and getting a job to  help pitch in, but you forbid it.  Then  you go and use it against me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look Susan, we're going to buy the  house.  I promise.  We will get the  house.  Just get off my back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent True is in the director's office once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to me.  I want him brought in  here.  You've already got a strong  case.  He'll turn states.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we have on him?  Manipulative  trading tactics?  What can we threaten  him with, license revocation?  He'll  never go for it.  We need more.  I know  he's up to something. I can feel it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't afford to leave him out there  any longer.  This girlfriend of his may  have already tipped him off.  He could  run at any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hasn't, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you possibly know that?  And  if you're right, and she's so loyal to  you, then why hasn't she given us any  information yet?  I want Davis brought  in by the end of the week.  Period.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True storms out of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie is sitting in a reception area filling out a job  application for a temp agency.  A woman is sitting  next her.  Debbie look completely morose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How many words can you type a minute?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guard Seth knows unlocks a judge's chambers for him. Seth goes into the private chamber and puts his bag down the leather sofa.  Huge bookcases, mahogany desk.  Judge  stuff. Seth looks at a photo resting on the desk.  It's a pictur Seth on the Mongoose.  His father is standing next to him smiling broadly.  It's the day his father bought him the  bike. Seth looks as emotional as we have ever seen him.  Marty  comes in through another door, startled to see Seth there

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?  I thought I  told you I didn't want to see you  again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad, I really need to talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want out of the firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.  So leave.  I don't really care  what you do anymore.  But your coming  here is unacceptable.  You want to cost  me my judgeship?  I can't have any  connection to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how you asked me to invest for  you?  Well I've got something.  It's a  sure thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got to be kidding me, Seth.  Get  out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm talking about making you half a  million on the next new issue.  And  it's safe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, listen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I play you off as a whale by having you  go in on a couple of big trades that JT  Marlin tells you to invest in.  You  know, prove your loyalty.  Figure  you'll drop $50,000.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you fucking nuts?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just listen to me.  After you drop the  fifty they'll have faith in you as a  customer.  When the next IPO comes out  you'll get a huge chunk for being so  loyal.  Then instead of holding onto it  until Michael can sell off all of the  common stock, you dump it the same day.   We'll make a fortune and the stock will  immediately collapse.  That should  raise enough red flags for the SEC to  come in and close shop within a week.   We walk rich and JT goes down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe we're having this  conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the way I want to get out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tough shit, Seth!  You better walk  right now before you're the one the SEC  comes after.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But this way I can leave and give them  a taste of their own medicine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty is just staring at his son.  He looks dumbstruck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand you.  I really  don't.  You think I'm going to help you  commit a crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crime?  You don't like these people  any more than I do.  The whole firm is  crooked.  We're serving justice.  And  who are we committing a crime against?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is bullshit rhetoric.  What's this  all about?  Do I have to play on your  terms?  An act of faith?  Is that it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just wanted to do this with someone I  trusted, that's all.  I'm getting out  like you told me to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it, Seth.  It's illegal!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth gets up, walks to the desk and picks up the phot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You remember this day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.  I bought you that bike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember what happened about a  month after this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want from me, Seth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you remember when I broke my leg?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (snaps) Of course I remember!  You were  hysterical. I had to get you to stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hysterical?  You mean like you are  right now?  I wasn't even crying, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry I couldn't get the job you wanted  me to have.  But you know what, who  gives a shit?  I'm good at what I do.   The casino was a business!!  A  legitimate business! And I ran it  pretty fucking well, Dad.  To think I  closed it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shocked) You closed it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I went after this job because I  thought it was what you wanted me to be  doing.  I didn't know they were a  fucking chop-shop when I went there. (laughs sadly) It's like I can't get away from it.   But I tried to make the changes you  told me to.  I did everything you said.   I'm leaving JT now.  I'm just asking  you to do this one thing with me.  Just  this one last thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty really considers him, perhaps for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Seth.  I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine, I'll find someone else.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth gets up and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth is in Debbie's living room with her.  They are  whispering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you gonna do now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm still gonna do it.  I have this  friend who may go in with me.  Till  then I'm gonna make as much money as I  can at the firm.  I don't care who gets  fucked anymore.  My father can go to  hell!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth please, my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think this is a good idea.  Why  don't you just quit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I told you.  I've invested too  much time.  And I have no fucking money  coming in anymore because Jeff tanked  my gold mine.  I need this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about finding a position at a real  brokerage house?  You're a great broker  now.  I'm sure you could easily get a  job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Doing what?  Ticket running?  Coming  from JT Marlin you think they're going  to let me trade for them?  There's no  way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth looks up at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you so against this anyway?   What do you care if I pull this off?   It'll be great for both of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just have a bad feeling about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, I gotta go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going?  Seth, wait.  I  need to talk to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dazed) I have to go figure this all out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth gets up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks out.  Debbie pauses at the door, wanting to run  after him, to TELL HIM!  She cries.  Her mother's call ma the decision for her.  She locks up and walks toward her  mother. There's a KNOCK back at the door and she runs toward it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (while unlocking) Baby, I'm so sorry.  I need to tell you  something I've been keeping in for...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens the door to Agent True and literally JUMPS from fear. True walks in without being invited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you do that.  Why don't you  tell me something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost hysterical) Be quiet, my mother's finally sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk to the living room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.  He's doing nothing.  But I  found out how Michael operates the  whole thing.  Let me give you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, you're a shitty witness.   Black secretaries are not as credible  as white stock brokers.  It's a fucked  up legal system.  We need Seth to  testify, not you.  Now what the fuck is  he up to?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hasn't said a word to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: True stares at her hard when...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a smart girl, Debbie.  Why are  you doing this to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Normally, we could play this game for a  bit, but this is just such a bad time  to fuck with me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want me to tell you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want me to go wake Mom? Maybe if we  all sit down and talk about things we  can figure out a way to have someone  come and give her her medication while  you're upstate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fuck you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give him up!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie finally loses it.  She begins to sob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead!  What's he doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Debbie, are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going in with a friend on an IPO  scam this week.  It's on the new issue.   I better get immunity you piece of  shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Keep talking to me like that.  That's  your best bet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is outside raking leaves when he hears the phone ri Susan looks up at him because he seems so jumpy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No! (calmer) I mean, I'll get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan looks at him nervously as he runs into the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The firm is going nuts.  An IPO from last week, Farrow Te just had its rip bumped to $2.  It's a big money day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not look like you are fucking  around today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is because I am not fucking  around.  I am making bank today and I  do not care who the fuck I take it  from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, out of breath, reaches the phone on the fourth rin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth!  Did you get my calls?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Harry, it's just been crazy here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell's happening with Farrow  Tech, it's dropped five points since I  bought it.  I wanna sell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sell now?  The stock is down!  You  don't make money in the market buying  high and selling low, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's going on?  Tell me why we  shouldn't just get out now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, here's the deal.  I told you  things would happen within sixty days,  it's only twenty so far, but the  situation here is explosive and I  wanted to get you involved.  That's why  I haven't returned any calls.  I've  been gathering information all morning.   So here it is: The stock's down for  tech reasons.  It's been on the  restricted list all week.  But it's the  same company.  As a matter of fact,  while it was on the restricted list,  Farrow was doing nothing but signing  more contracts.  I'm telling you it's  looking like our next big one here.   Hold on a second, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth pushes hold.  Jim Young has walked in front of the b and begins to speak to the firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just got word from Michael.  The rip on  Farrow Tech is now three dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place explodes.  Seth gets back on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen to this, Harry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth holds the phone out toward the chaos.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ, what's going on over  there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See what I'm saying?  People know.  The  place is going nuts.  It's already up a  point and its just coming off the  restricted list.  I'm advising all my  clients to get in on this, and heavy.   Hold on a second, let me close the door  to my office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth holds the phone next to the open drawer of his desk, then slams it shut.  He then clambers under his desk for quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, now you get the same stock  that we picked up at eight, only now  it's at four.  Now, when it was at  eight I told you it was going to  twenty, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, and it's still going there,  probably even higher now.  This doesn't  change anything except that you're  going to make more money than you did  before.  Look Harry, I liked it at  eight, I love it at four.  It's an  average down for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dollar cost averaging.  If you own a  hundred shares at ten dollars and now  you buy another one hundred at five,  that's a F200 shares at $7.50 a share.   Your cost basis is lower.  Now if I get  you involved at ten and take you out at  fifteen, you've made how many points  Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly.  But if I get you involved at  seven and a half and I take you out at  fifteen, well that's seven and a half  points, that's even better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shaky, but turning toward  Seth) I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also have a bullet on it.  A couple  of days ago Dan Dorfman, on CNBC, put a  heavy buy recommendation on Farrow  Tech.  Reason being, he's been in  contact with the CEO of the company and  they feel FDA approval will happen in  the next three or four weeks. (gaining speed) Listen to me.  Off the record, I just  called a broker friend of mine at  another firm and had him pick me up  fifty thousand shares under my sister- in-law's name.  I'm going to put all my  kids through college with this stock.   Look, I have a thousand more phone  calls to make, Harry.  I have to call  every one of my clients and give them  this same opportunity.  Remember when  we first spoke?  I told you that this  firm only had five or six great ideas a  year!  Well, Harry, this is one of  those ideas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth awkwardly reaches up for his glass of water on the d spilling it all over himself.  He doesn't make a sound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I remember you saying something about  buying a house, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, how'd you like to pay for it  tomorrow... in cash?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Serious as cancer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I've got is the fifty thousand from  our savings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, you've got a call on line three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's my secretary.  I gotta go.  I  have a lot of clients I need to make  money for today.  What's it gonna be,  Harry?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth is on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you were coming over tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't make it.  I'm not feeling well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come over.  I'll take care of you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm going to just stay here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, then I'll come over there.   I'll bring you some soup.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  Don't.  Mom's not doing too well  either.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh shit.  I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's stressing me out a bit.  I'll talk  to you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty sits in his den going over the mail. He hears his w on the phone with Seth in the next room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, Seth.  But you really went too  far this time.  I thought we were past  the lying.  Well then when you figured  it out you should have said something.   I understand that.  It's trues, he  definitely hasn't helped any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty stands at the doorway listening to his wife.  She h her back to him and does not hear him walk up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course he's upset.  You guys are  going to work through it though.  I'm  sure of it.  He loves you, Seth.  Do  you know that?  It's important that you  know that.  Okay.  Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The pitch is wild again today.  Everybody's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not fucking around today, guys.   I'm sure you all know that we're going  to be getting a lot of heat for what  Farrow Tech did yesterday, so be smart  on the phone.  Calm them down.  I don't  want people dumping their shares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam! I got a Mr. Klastow, he's super  hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Klastow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We immediately hear the man screaming through the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.  I understand.  Right.  I'm  sorry.  We couldn't foresee this when  we... Right.  Okay.  I'll do it right  now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam pulls out a sell ticket and quickly fills it out.  H then takes it to Greg to be signed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (enraged) What the fuck is this?  You think I'm  gonna sign a sell ticket for you?  What  did I just say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Greg takes the slip and rips it up in front of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call him back and explain the situation  to him! (to everyone) No one's gonna unload today, no one!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adam goes back to his seat badly shaken.  The whole team  looks on in disbelief.  You can't just rip up a sell tick

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth.  Line three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth pushes the blinking light, still dazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth Davis here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Seth, how are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hears his dad's voice and snaps to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I change your mind about doing this  IPO scheme?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.  I'm sorry.  I already found  someone who's going in with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well then I'm going to help you out  with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna do it with me?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't do it, Seth, but I want to  at least make sure you don't get  caught.  I have someone I know over at  the Parthenon Group that will talk to  you about it.  Come over to the house  tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Dad.  I'm so glad you called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sheryl's answers another incoming call for Seth.  It's a  fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, I've got a Harry Reynard on the  phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pass him on.  Harry, I was going to   call you today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (desperate) I want my money back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I know you're pissed, Harry, they  had a setback.  But don't worry about  it, it's become a goal stock.  I plan  to bring you eight or nine points over  the course of this year.  People are  talking about it like it's the next  Microsoft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (almost crying) Listen Seth, I'm in a heap of trouble  here.  I need that money back.  I was  supposed to use it for a down payment  on a house for my family.  We're going  to lose the house now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, listen, it's going to rebound.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Seth!!  I need the money back!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.  I can't do that.  I have to  go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth hangs up the phone.  He looks very disturbed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If he calls back, I'm not here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry looks to make sure his co-workers did not hear this exchange.  His supervisor walks in as the phone begins to RING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry, do you have that status report  ready?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Michelle.  I'll bring it right  over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I also wanted to ask you about...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JT Marlin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (curt) I'll talk to you after I finish with  this call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry turns his head away from her before she can even re

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OOOkay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth Davis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I ask who's calling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Harry Reynard!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Mr. Reynard, but Mr. Davis  just stepped out for a meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God... (slamming the phone) ...Damn it!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around his cubicle, sees the photo of his family his desk, and begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth is sitting having lunch with Debbie.  He looks very  upset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you gonna talk to me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to tell you, Seth.  I  mean think about it.  If you pull off  this IPO deal and I'm associated with  you, what do you think is gonna happen  do me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They won't be able to prove anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who says they have to?  I'm gonna lose  my job unless I put some distance  between us now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The front door opens as Agent True, with three other FBI  agents, walk straight toward Seth's table.  Debbie is fac the door and sees them immediately.  Her face goes pale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop at the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth Davis, you're under arrest for the  violation of 26 SEC and NASD  regulations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (trying to be genuine) What are you doing?  What's this all  about?  Seth, I'll get you out of this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't call my father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sit down, Debbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth hears him call her name.  He looks at her as he's  cuffed.  He looks as scared and hurt as a man can feel  without crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry stands against a wall, sweating heavily.  He looks  completely disheveled.  His expression is one of  anticipation. A plate flies across the room, SHATTERING on the wall.  H cringes, sinking into a fetal position on the floor.  He  CRIES. Susan walks across the floor toward him.  Max & Sara's cr now permeates the apartment.  She stands over him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How could you be so stupid!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Max and Sara stand in the doorway watching in tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you thinking, Harry?  The  kids, the house, our future!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (crying) I'm sorry.  I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan leans against the wall, then slinks down next to hi and begins to sob.  Harry reaches over to console her.  S backhands him hard across the side of his head, sending h glasses FLYING and him cowering back.  They both cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth is brought in through the side door and led to a sma interrogation room.  He walks in to see MARTY at a table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (screaming) Why did you bring him in?  He didn't do  anything!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on, Seth?  Did  you talk to them about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What                        !  Of course not.  Why is he  here!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure, Seth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'm sure.  Not a word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Agent True) That's it.  I'm walking out of here in  three seconds unless you charge me with  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent True reaches over to a tape recorder and pushes pla It's a recording of Marty's earlier conversation with Set

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I change your mind about doing this  IPO scheme?... Then I'm going to help  you out with it... I want to at least  make sure you don't get caught.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is sitting on the floor of the living room as his w LEAVES with the kids.  He is crying again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Harry is in the corner of the garage.  He has a small bla case in front of him.  He opens it to reveal a .9mm handg He loads the gun back and places it back in its case.  He wearing his best suit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what do you want from me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We want you to testify.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No whit.  What are you offering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Full immunity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about my father?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He won't do any time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I haven't done anything illegal, Seth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what's the deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lose my judgeship just going along  for the ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got nothing to do with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure you do.  You're gonna release that  tape to the press.  Makes your case so  much more glamorous with the  involvement of a Federal judge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No deal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take my father out the back door right  now and bring him home.  He has nothing  to do with this case at all.  If his  name shows up in one newspaper, I don't  testify.  And I mean that.  For me,  it'd be worth going to jail for.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're serious?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're nuts.  You want to do it  that way?  Fine.  Then no immunity for  you, pal.  I need one of you to face  the music.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, don't be stupid.  He's right.  I  won't see a day in jail.  They'll get  you for at least four years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care.  Go home, Dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, alright, alright.  Before we  start dealing here, just what are you  offering?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna hand you this case on a  silver fucking platter.  I know  everything you don't.  I know how it  all works.  How Michael makes his  money, where it goes, and who's getting  it.  Now what happens tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You go back to work tomorrow like  nothing happened.  Just for one day.  I  need your client book and your whole C- drive backed up onto floppy.  But don't  get any stupid inclinations to travel  abroad.  We know where your father  lives.  You're going away, kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  You mentioned that earlier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, yeah, yeah, yeah, you little  fuck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent True walks over to take Seth away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to True) Give me a couple of minutes with him,  would you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Agent True just nods and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, Dad.  I am so fucking sorry.   I didn't mean to do this to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhh.  Let me speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marty takes a deep breath and closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I came up to you behind that car,  it was the hardest thing I ever had to  bear.  I just wanted to make your pain  disappear.  I don't even know how to  describe the feeling.  But I want you  to know something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He begins to cry.  Seth has never seen him cry before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a single day of my life has gone by  where I do not think about that moment,  where I do not dream I was there for  one more chance.  If I could take back  just one thing in my life, Seth, do one  thing over... I am more sorry than you  will ever know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth leans across and they embrace tightly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth is on the phone though not fired up as usual.  He lo very nervous and continually checks the time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth, line two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth hears a click before he can even say okay.  He hang the phone, stands up, and addresses the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to lunch, boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you, Seth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth stops by Chris and drops a note on his desk.  He's o the phone while he reads the letter.  He stares at Seth  leaving the room.  After a moment of thought, he too begi to pack. We follow Seth out to the reception room where Debbie wat him approach.  Seth looks at her, but says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seth comes out of the building and heads to his car.  As as he begins to cross the lot he notices a man coming tow him.  It is HARRY.  There are walking right towards one  another. Harry accidentally drops his briefcase.  The contents spi onto the floor.  Seth bends over to help.  He nervously l around as he helps Harry, waiting for the Feds to show. unknowingly picks up the gun case and hands it to Harry. Harry is very gracious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiling genuinely) No problem.
